item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, February 11, 2025 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. I tasted Honda's spicy rodent-repelling tape and I will do it again (2021) (923 points | 282 comments)
2. The subtle art of designing physical controls for cars (129 points | 64 comments)
3. Launch HN: A0.dev (YC W25) – React Native App Generator (132 points | 50 comments)
4. Backblaze Drive Stats for 2024 (309 points | 93 comments)
5. Thomson Reuters wins first major AI copyright case in the US (149 points | 62 comments)
6. Reviving the joy and honor of working with your hands (2015) (60 points | 18 comments)
7. Smoke in the cabin of two 737 MAX caused by Load Reduction Device system [video] (71 points | 21 comments)
8. The hallucinatory thoughts of the dying mind (85 points | 51 comments)
9. A Year of Telepathy (14 points | 11 comments)
10. Empirical Health (YC S23) Is Hiring Design Engineers in NYC ( | hide)
11. Postmortem: The singular design of Namco's Katamari Damacy (2004) (22 points | 1 comment)
12. DeepScaleR: Surpassing O1-Preview with a 1.5B Model by Scaling RL (235 points | 92 comments)
13. Surrealist Compliment Generator (17 points | 6 comments)
14. Zeroperl: Sandboxing Perl with WebAssembly (7 points | 12 comments)
15. Building a personal, private AI computer on a budget (300 points | 186 comments)
16. Intel's Battlemage Architecture (135 points | 88 comments)
17. ASTRA: HackerRank's coding benchmark for LLMs (13 points | 4 comments)
18. The Butter Thesis (2019) (17 points | 8 comments)
19. Associated Press Barred from Oval Office for Not Using 'Gulf of America' (7 points | discuss)
20. The first yearly drop in average CPU performance in its 20 years of benchmarks (39 points | 14 comments)
21. NOAA's public weather data powers the local forecasts on your phone and TV (44 points | 17 comments)
22. Ohm: A user-friendly parsing toolkit for JavaScript and TypeScript (3 points | discuss)
23. Trust, 2-Party Relays, and QUIC (42 points | 28 comments)
24. Nvidia's RTX 5090 power connectors are melting (300 points | 325 comments)
25. LLMs can teach themselves to better predict the future (127 points | 59 comments)
26. Incremental compilation instantly rebuilds the Zig compiler [video] (55 points | 10 comments)
27. Anchoreum: A game for learning CSS anchor positioning (67 points | 21 comments)
28. Show HN: Infinite horizontal arrays of text editors (59 points | 37 comments)
29. Craftax: (Crafter and NetHack) RL Environment in Jax (8 points | 1 comment)
30. Firing programmers for AI is a mistake (597 points | 717 comments)
